item.title: 特斯拉推出高性能版 Model 3 紧凑型轿车
item.description: 特斯拉电动汽车公司网站周二显示，该公司在美国推出了 Model 3 紧凑型轿车的性能版，售价 52,990 美元。【原文：Tesla launched a performance variant of its Model 3 compact sedan in the United States at $52,990, the electric vehicle maker's website showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 由于中国需求低迷，Gucci 所有者 Kering 第一季度销售额下降 10
item.description: 法国奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周二公布的第一季度销售额下降了 10%，受其明星品牌古驰（Gucci）业绩放缓的拖累，古驰在进行全面设计的同时，也受到了亚洲市场疲软的影响。【原文：French luxury group Kering reported a 10% drop in first-quarter sales on Tuesday, dragged down by a slowdown at its star label Gucci, which suffered from weakness in Asia while undergoing a design overhaul.】

item.title: 通知显示特斯拉将在得克萨斯州工厂裁员近 2700 人
item.description: 特斯拉在一份工人调整和再培训通知（WARN）中表示，这家电动汽车制造商将在德克萨斯州工厂裁员 2688 人。【原文：Tesla will lay off 2,688 employees at its Texas factory, the electric vehicle maker said in a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) notice.】

item.title: UPS 在拖累联邦快递盈利的美国邮政服务工作中获利
item.description: 联合包裹服务公司（United Parcel Service）首席执行官卡罗尔-托梅（Carol Tome）周二表示，在竞争对手联邦快递（FedEx）苦苦挣扎于航空货运业务之后，该公司预计其新赢得的美国邮政（USPS）航空货运合同将在第一年和超过五年的合同期内实现盈利。【原文：United Parcel Service expects its newly won U.S. Postal Service (USPS) air cargo contract to be profitable in its first year and throughout the more than five-year deal, after rival FedEx struggled with the business, Chief Executive Carol Tome said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 智利电信公司 Entel 将 2024 年投资额提高至 6.18 亿美元
item.description: 智利电信公司 Entel 周二表示，该公司计划今年投资 6.18 亿美元，略高于 2023 年的支出计划。【原文：Chilean telecommunications firm Entel plans to invest $618 million this year, the company said on Tuesday, slightly above its 2023 spending.】

item.title: 美国 3 月新屋销售反弹
item.description: 3 月份美国新建独栋住宅的销售量较 2 月份下调后的水平有所反弹，这得益于市场上旧房持续短缺的支撑，但抵押贷款利率的回升可能会抑制这一势头。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes rebounded in March from February's downwardly revised level, drawing support from a persistent shortage of previously owned houses on the market, but momentum could be curbed by a resurgence in mortgage rates.】

item.title: 苹果公司称将于 5 月 7 日举行发布会
item.description: 苹果公司周二表示，该公司将于 5 月 7 日举行发布会，有报道称苹果将于下月推出期待已久的改版 iPad Pro 和 iPad Air。【原文：Apple will hold an event on May 7, the company said on Tuesday, amid reports that it would roll out the long-anticipated revamped versions of the iPad Pro and iPad Air next month.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，沃尔玛支持的金融科技公司 One 推出 "先买后付 "贷款
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二报道，沃尔玛控股的金融科技初创公司 One 已开始在该公司的一些美国零售店为电子产品和电动工具等大件商品提供 "先买后付"（BNPL）贷款。【原文：Walmart’s majority-owned fintech startup One has started offering buy now, pay later (BNPL) loans for big-ticket items like electronics and power tools at some of the retailer's U.S. stores, CNBC reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 提供 "风险资本 "投资机会的基金让投资者体验到了备忘录般的乐趣
item.description: 最近几周，一只允许股东投资私有科技公司的新基金让投资者大呼过瘾，同时也引起了晨星公司（Morningstar）和竞争对手方舟投资管理公司（ARK Investment Management）等机构的批评。 Destiny Tech100 的股价自 3 月 27 日推出以来上涨了约 200%，在此之前的三周内，该基金的股价跌宕起伏，自首次发行以来上涨了 1172%。【原文：A new fund that allows shareholders access to privately owned technology companies has sent investors on a wild ride in recent weeks while eliciting criticism from the likes of Morningstar and competitor ARK Investment Management. Shares of Destiny Tech100 are up some 200% since its March 27 launch, following a tumultuous three-week run that has seen it rise by as much as 1,172% from its debut pr】

item.title: 美国住宅建筑商 NVR 因住房供应紧张刺激销售，利润超出预期
item.description: 美国住宅建筑商 NVR 公司第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是住房供应紧张推动了对新房的需求。【原文：U.S. homebuilder NVR Inc beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit as tight housing supply drove demand for new homes.】

item.title: 全球股票市场中性对冲基金大放异彩
item.description: 全球股票市场中性对冲基金吸引了投资者，因为在全球利率不确定和地缘政治紧张局势下，这些基金能比传统股票市场带来更好的回报。【原文：Global equity market-neutral hedge funds have lured investors as they can deliver better returns in times of global rates uncertainty and geopolitical tension than traditional stock markets.】

item.title: 太阳能公司 Sunpower 财务报告存在问题
item.description: 美国太阳能储能和能源服务提供商 SunPower 在周二提交的一份监管文件中表示，该公司已发现 2022 财年的业绩存在误报。【原文：SunPower has identified misstatements in its results for fiscal year 2022, the U.S. solar power storage and energy service provider said in a regulatory filing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 4 月商业活动降温；通胀指标喜忧参半
item.description: 由于需求疲软，美国 4 月份的商业活动降温至四个月来的最低点，而通胀率则略有下降，即使投入价格大幅上涨，这表明随着美联储寻找经济衰退到足以使通胀率进一步下降的迹象，未来可能会出现一些缓解。【原文：U.S. business activity cooled in April to a four-month low due to weaker demand, while rates of inflation eased slightly even as input prices rose sharply, suggesting some possible relief ahead as the Federal Reserve looks for signs that the economy is ebbing enough to bring inflation down further.】

item.title: 美国石油天然气并购在 2023 财年大放异彩后创下季度纪录
item.description: 数据提供商 Enverus 周二表示，第一季度美国石油和天然气交易额达到创纪录的 510 亿美元，延续了去年以美国页岩油田为中心的激烈并购步伐。【原文：U.S. oil and gas deals hit a record $51 billion in the first quarter, a continuation of last year's fierce merger pace centered in the top U.S. shale field, data provider Enverus said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加拿大竞争局对邦吉（Bunge）与维特拉（Viterra）的合并提案表示严重关切
item.description: 加拿大竞争局周二表示，已发现美国谷物商邦吉（Bunge）和嘉能可（Glencore）支持的维特拉公司（Viterra）之间的拟议合并存在重大竞争问题。【原文：Canada's Competition Bureau on Tuesday said it had identified major competition concerns around the proposed merger between U.S. grains merchant Bunge and Glencore-backed Viterra.】

item.title: 可口可乐签署 11 亿美元协议，使用微软云和人工智能服务
item.description: 微软周二表示，可口可乐已签署了一项价值 11 亿美元的五年协议，将使用微软的云计算和人工智能服务。【原文：Microsoft said on Tuesday that Coca-Cola had signed a $1.1 billion five-year deal to use its cloud computing and artificial intelligence services.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯-索诺玛公司因 "美国制造 "被美国联邦贸易委员会罚款
item.description: 威廉姆斯-索诺玛公司（Williams-Sonoma）将支付 318 万美元的民事罚款，以了结美国联邦贸易委员会对其违反 2020 年 7 月命令，谎称部分产品为 "美国制造 "的指控。【原文：Williams-Sonoma will pay a $3.18 million civil fine to settle U.S. Federal Trade Commission charges it violated a July 2020 order by falsely claiming that some of its products were "Made in USA."】

item.title: 需求强劲，洛克希德-马丁公司第一季度利润超出预期
item.description: 美国武器制造商洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）周二公布的第一季度销售额和利润超出华尔街预期，原因是一触即发的地缘政治紧张局势促使一些国家增加国防开支，从而推动了对新武器的需求。【原文：U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter sales and profit on Tuesday, as simmering geopolitical tensions prompted some countries to boost their defense spending, driving demand for new weapons.】

item.title: 如果无法偿还债务，菲斯科可能在 30 天内寻求破产保护
item.description: 菲斯科在周二提交的一份监管文件中披露，如果不能从债权人那里获得足够的救济和足够的流动资金来履行当前的债务义务，菲斯科可能不得不在30天内申请破产保护。【原文：Fisker may have to file for bankruptcy protection within 30 days if it does not get adequate relief from its creditors and enough liquidity to meet its current debt obligations, it disclosed in a regulatory filing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉计划通过自愿计划在德国裁员 400 人
item.description: 特斯拉周二表示，其目标是在柏林附近的德国千兆工厂裁员 400 人，并补充说计划通过自愿计划而非强制裁员来实现这一目标。【原文：Tesla on Tuesday said it was targeting 400 job cuts at its German gigafactory near Berlin, adding the plan was to achieve this through a voluntary programme instead of forced layoffs.】

item.title: 谷歌投资 6.4 亿美元在荷兰新建数据中心
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周二表示，将投资 6 亿欧元（约合 6.4062 亿美元）在荷兰格罗宁根市新建一个数据中心，并表示这项投资将创造 125 个新的工作岗位。【原文：Alphabet-owned Google is investing 600 million euros ($640.62 million) in a new data centre in the Dutch city of Groningen, it said on Tuesday, adding the investment will create 125 new jobs.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲供过于求，捷蓝航空下调年度收入预期
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周二报告称，由于拉美地区运力臃肿，该公司第一季度收入不佳，因此下调了全年收入预期，导致其股价盘前下跌 10%。【原文：JetBlue Airways trimmed its annual revenue forecast on Tuesday after reporting lukewarm first-quarter revenue due to bloated capacity in Latin America, sending its shares down 10% premarket.】

item.title: 生产强劲，自由港麦克莫兰公司季度利润超出预期
item.description: 铜矿商 Freeport-McMoRan 周二公布的第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于产量增加和成本下降。【原文：Copper miner Freeport-McMoRan beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Tuesday, helped by higher production and easing costs.】

item.title: 菲利普-莫里斯公司因加热烟草棒需求旺盛，业绩超出预期
item.description: 菲利普莫里斯国际公司（Philip Morris International）周二公布的第一季度利润和收入超出市场预期，主要得益于加热烟草产品和 Zyn 尼古丁袋的强劲需求。【原文：Philip Morris International on Tuesday surpassed market expectations for first-quarter profit and revenue, helped by robust demand for its heated tobacco product and Zyn nicotine pouches.】

item.title: 短缺是铜价攀上新高的关键所在
item.description: 未来几个月，由于出现短缺，预计铜价将继续保持上涨势头，目前铜价已逼近每吨 10,000 美元的心理关口。【原文：Upward momentum that has propelled copper prices to within a whisker of the psychological $10,000 a metric ton mark is expected to be sustained by the appearance of shortages over the coming months.】

item.title: 大众汽车掌握着保时捷与法拉利竞争的钥匙
item.description: 保时捷公司能否缩小与头号竞争对手法拉利的估值差距，取决于其主要所有者大众汽车公司是否准备后退一步，给予这家德国跑车制造商更多的自由来削减成本和塑造未来。【原文：Porsche AG's ability to close a hefty valuation discount to top rival Ferrari could hinge on whether its main owner, Volkswagen, is prepared to take a step back, giving the German sports car maker more freedom to cut costs and shape its future.】

item.title: 独家报道厄瓜多尔正在研究新的亚马逊和海洋相关债转股方案
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，厄瓜多尔正在研究新的债换自然方案，一个是将资金投入亚马逊雨林，另一个是好莱坞明星莱昂纳多-迪卡普里奥（Leonardo DiCaprio）支持的巨型海洋保护区。【原文：Ecuador is scoping out new debt-for-nature swaps, one to funnel funds into the Amazon rainforest and another for a giant ocean protection zone backed by Hollywood star Leonardo DiCaprio, people familiar with the matter have told Reuters.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司因国防需求强劲而销售额上升
item.description: 美国武器制造商洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）周二公布的第一季度销售额增长近14%，原因是地缘政治紧张局势一触即发，促使一些国家增加国防开支，从而推动了对新武器的需求。【原文：U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin on Tuesday reported a near 14% rise in first-quarter sales, as simmering geopolitical tensions prompt some countries to boost their defense spending, driving demand for new weapons.】

item.title: 指数产品需求增加，MSCI 第一季度利润大增
item.description: 周二，MSCI 第一季度利润增长，原因是对其指数产品和分析服务的需求强劲，而美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）降息的可能性减少引发了市场波动。【原文：MSCI's first-quarter profit rose on Tuesday, due to strong demand for its index products and analytics services as the likelihood of fewer U.S. Federal Reserve rate cuts sparked volatility.】

item.title: 辉瑞与 Moderna 的 COVID 疫苗专利之争在英国拉开帷幕
item.description: 辉瑞和 BioNTech 要求伦敦一家法院撤销竞争对手 Moderna 对 COVID-19 疫苗开发关键技术的专利，这是周二开始的全球法律战的最新一轮。【原文：Pfizer and BioNTech asked a London court to revoke rival Moderna's patents over technology key to the development of vaccines for COVID-19, as the latest leg of a global legal battle began on Tuesday.】
